snippet: A decision that threw out Connecticut’s education financing system as unconstitutional spoke to a larger nationwide truth....
abstract: News Analysis; ruling by Connecticut Judge Thomas G Moukawsher declaring state's school financing system unconstitutional speaks to larger frustrations with nation's education system and persistent gap in performance between rich and poor and minority and white students; frustration evident in ruling centers on widespread understanding that American public school system is broken and efforts to fix it unsuccessful.
lead_paragraph: A decision that threw out Connecticut’s education financing system as unconstitutional spoke to a larger nationwide truth.

headline.print_headline: Crux of Grim Ruling: Schools Are Broken
headline.main: An F-Minus for America’s Schools From a Fed-Up Judge
